name: Merry StrangeMas Bundle
description: Our favorite single cup brewer bundled with our favorite coffee and a box of filters to get you started. You get: 12 Ounces of Kenya Nyeri AA Kangocho 1 Clever Coffee Dripper 1 box of unbleached filters Purchased individually you would pay around $37.00 plus shipping but the Strange Elf has taken over the website and is sneaking out the door with the whole bunch for $35.00 with free shipping*. *When you get to checkout, enter the code: STRANGEMASELF for free shipping. Free shipping applies to this item only.

name: Guatemala Acatenango Finca El Carmen
description: Let's talk about dessert coffee for a sec. The term usually describes a coffee on the darker side, something with a slight, but pleasant, bitterness that might pair nicely with sweets. The El Carmen is the dessert. Chocolate, vanilla, caramel and dark cherry with a bit of orange peel. No pop tart, this is sweet in a jazz way. Please do not rush this coffee. When your water is near ready, grind and enjoy the dry aroma before brewing. Flavor Complexity: 3 Brightness: 3 Sweetness: 4 Body: 3 Dry Fragrance: 5 Balance: 3 Evaluation Method: Clever Dripper Read about our evaluation scores. Dig the details at Coffee Shrub.

name: Kenya Nyeri AA Kangocho Coop
description: Lock the doors, close the blinds. We are starting a Drink Your Coffee Cool movement, and the Kenya Nyeri AA Kangocho Coop is our banner. The transformation of this coffee in the cup from hot to cool is a wonderful ride. So much fruit, so much brightness, but ridiculously lush body. How is that even possible? Don't think about it, just enjoy. Flavor Complexity: 5 Brightness: 4 Sweetness: 4 Body: 5 Dry Fragrance: 4 Balance: 3 Evaluation Method: Clever Dripper Read about our evaluation scores. Dig the details at Coffee Shrub.

name: Sumatra Lintong Dolok Sanggul
description: In the bad old days, you might have purchased coffee from Sumatra the way you would pick out topsoil for your garden: the darker, the better. Truthfully, many of us just didn't know what to do with these earthy, often funky coffees other than roast them until they were oily, smoky and strong. As with all of our Indonesians we seek out coffees that can be handled more delicately and produce a sweeter cup while preserving the unique flavor profiles of the region. The Lintong Dolok Sanggul shines at Full City roast with such a clean cup that we thought we might have mixed up our samples. Sweetness rolls straight through the finish. Flavor Complexity: 5 Brightness: 2 Sweetness: 4 Body: 4 Dry Fragrance: 4 Balance: 4 Evaluation Method: Clever Dripper Read about our evaluation scores. Dig the details at Coffee Shrub.

name: East Timor, Cooperativa Cafe Timor, Fair Trade Certified
description: This is roaster Kati's favorite. Not only has the purchase of this bean provided a FREE healthcare system for all of its workers, it is like a campfire in your mouth. Think toasted marshmallows and chocolate, combined with a smokey, earthy taste.

name: Bali Blue Moon, Rainforest Alliance and Organic
description:
This coffee was grown in the Kintamani highlands, sitting atop a large volcanic plateau between 1300-1700 meters altitude. The region is serious about it's Organic and Rainforest Alliance certifications, ensuring that pesticides are never used, fertilizers are 100% organic, and bird and land health is maintained. 

This bean is smooth and chocolatey. Perfect with some bubur injun, or whatever else strikes your fancy (perhaps french toast in America?).

name: Tanzania Ruvuma
description: The Ruvuma region has been unable to reach the international market for some time, due to its poor infrastructure and uncertain political situation. Times are looking up for this southwestern area of Tanzania, however; and wow is it exquisite. Not only do these beans carry the lingering taste of dark chocolate-covered cherries (a trait not typical of an African coffee), we're proud to tell you that Ruvuma farmers, pulperies, and distributors have a beneficial trade agreement in order to keep their processes as sustainable as possible. Taking care of the farmer, who thus protects the soil, tastes just as good as enjoying a proper brew of this Tanzanian bean.

name: Brazil Alta Mogiana Sao Francisco
description:
One of our gracious hosts on our trip to Brazil, Nilton and family's new crop coffee arrived a couple of days before I stopped at Brasc Coffee Importers the beginning of November. 

Faced with the choice of a more standard 17/18 screen size sorting (what we had last year) or a slightly smaller and varied screen size sorting I of course went with the second choice.

name: Brazil Bob-O-Link
description: Aroma hints of toasted nuts and chocolate. Sweet, silky smooth and clean, this coffee sweetens further as it cools and carries faint fruit/citrus flavor.  Medium body with a soft finish.  Crowd pleaser.  Put yer hands in the air!

name: Nicaragua Finca Las Brisas
description: Directly Traded Microlot from a farm Brian visited during a trip to Selva Negra. Yep, that's him on the bicycle-powered depulper. This coffee really sings in a Clever Dripper with perfect sweetness, medium-full body and a combination of nuttiness, spice and fruit.

name: Sulawesi Toraja
description: Full-bodied Indonesian, current favorite on the pour over bar at the London Underground in Blacksburg. Slightly earthy with deep chocolate and spice, nice finish. Medium roast.

name: Black Lightning
description: Our darkest Roast. A blend of our directly traded coffees: Nicaragua Selva Negra Estate fully washed process, Selva Negra Estate aged natural process, and Brazil Bob-o-Link.

name: Nicaragua Selva Negra
description: Our premiere relationship coffee. The very first coffee we purchased for our roasting operation, and our best seller. Selva Negra plantation represents the epitome of sustainable coffee. A family farm where every aspect of coffee cultivation is carefully maintained to reduce environmental impact and improve the lives of the labor force. This coffee is mild, medium bodied with subtle chocolate notes, some toasted almond and spice and a very clean finish in a lighter roast.

name: Bobolink Microlot 184 - Celso & Gertrudes Family
description: Picked specifically, selectively, and with extra care, this is one of this year's crop microlots from the Bobolink collective. We visited this family on our day long journey to many of the Bobolink farmers. Being in Brazil, we were able to watch some World Cup Soccer during lunch on a small tv - the US Team even. The best part was Paulley getting tricked by a kid telling him to go eat - and promptly losing his prime viewing seat to the kid.

name: 6 Month Coffee Subscription (USPS Delivery)
description: We make it easy. 2 pounds of coffee roasted and shipped on the 15th of each month for 6 months. 12 pounds total. Choose one coffee or select Roaster's Choice for a variety. United States addresses only, please. Shipping costs are included.

name: 6 Month Coffee Subscription (Local Delivery)
description: We make it easy. 1 pound of coffee roasted and delivered on the 1st and 15th of each month for 6 months. 12 pounds total. Choose one coffee or select Roaster's Choice for a variety. This selection is for Blacksburg area coffee lovers. Please add Local Pick-Up/Delivery to your cart and select location.

name: Presses
description: Bodum coffee presses

options.name: 15 ounce travel press green w/ extra lid
15 ounce travel press red w/ extra lid

name: AeroPress
description:
If you want cheesy marketing language to convince you to buy, go to the manufacturer's website (www.aerobie.com).

Yeah, it's a novelty, but a lightweight, easy to travel with novelty that can make a pretty darn good concentrated brew. Comes with a carrying pouch. Buy two and you'll have a spare pair of mittens on a cold winter day (line stolen from Reverend Horton Heat).

name: Abid Clever Coffee Dripper
description: The Clever Coffee Dripper combines the best features of French press and filter drip brewing, eliminating the drawbacks of each. With French press brewing, you have control over steeping time, but heat loss and sediment in the cup can be a problem. Brewing with a paper filter is easy and convenient; the problem is lack of control over steeping time (i.e. the coffee begins to drain immediately). By adding a stopper to the filtercone, the Clever Coffee Dripper combines control over steeping time with a sediment-free cup. We call this a "full immersion brewing" method. Drippers come with a lid and have a "Clever Coffee Dripper" logo.

name: Chemex Coffee Brewers
description:
Pick a size and style. 6, 8, 10 cup brewers (30, 40, 50 ounces) in either the original design with a polished wood collar, or the glass handle design. 10 chemex FSU-100 unbleached filters squares included to get you started brewing.

Glass handle 8 and 10 cup and wood collar 8 cup available now, others are back ordered and I will add them as they come in.

name: Coffee Brewing Filters
description:
Filtropa #2 100 count box bleached

FSU-100: 100 prefolded natural filter squares. For all units EXCEPT the pint coffeemakers. 

For pint coffeemakers use the FP-2: 100 unfolded "half moon" filters.
